title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 December 2013 - XWiki

09:06 <tmortagne> vmassol1: there is a but in latest watchlist mail with main wiki links but not sure if it's something we know and is fixed in 5.2.2 or not  
09:06 <tmortagne> s/but/bug/  
09:13 <vmassol1> what bug is it?  
09:15 <tmortagne> vmassol1: try clicking on any main wiki page link  
09:17 <tmortagne> it's only with main wiki, I checked the main wiki descriptor and it's correct  
09:17 <tmortagne> those links should start with main.xwiki.org according to the descriptor  
09:18 <vmassol1> indeed goes to the wronf subwiki  
09:18 <vmassol1> \*wrong  
09:18 <tmortagne> but they seems to assume that the URL in the context is related to main wiki and take the domain there  
09:18 <vmassol1> might have been fixed, I don't know  
09:18 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:18 <tmortagne> I guess the first access to xwiki.org was through extensions.xwiki.org  
09:19 <vmassol> yes probably  
09:19 <tmortagne> I don't remember any fix about that  
09:19 <vmassol> so it's probably not fixed  
09:19 <vmassol> I think this is something we've had for a long time  
09:19 <vmassol> must be the Scheduler issue  
09:19 <tmortagne> nop I don't think so  
09:19 <tmortagne> I don't remember this issue  
09:19 <vmassol> caching the wiki in the jib  
09:19 <vmassol> job  
09:19 <vmassol> I remember it  
09:20 <vmassol> I've seen it in the past I'm pretty sure  
09:20 <tmortagne> I have seen issue like this but only when the main wiki did not had proper descriptor  
09:20 <vmassol> I'll try to reproduce  
09:21 <vmassol> bb in 15mn

10:11 <vmassol> ok starting 5.2.2 release  
10:25 <vmassol> hmm this looks very cool for xwiki multitenancy: http://www.fasterj.com/tools/multitenancy.shtml  
10:25 <msmeria> vmassol: I'm testing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9755 and it doesn't seem to be fixed on 5.3rc1  
10:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> msmeria: ok I'll check thanks  
10:26 <msmeria> yw  
10:28 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <evalica> has quit  
10:38 <vmassol> msmeria: work very well  
10:39 <vmassol> \*works  
10:39 <vmassol> I installed 5.3-SNAPSHOT from our remote repo  
10:39 <vmassol> what doesn't work?  
10:39 <vmassol> actually msmeria there's very little chance it doesn't work  
10:39 <vmassol> I ahve an automated functional test for it  
10:41 <msmeria> vmassol: my test was this: I installed the FAQ app and added a new entry "test ?" and the resulting entry was "test ??"  
10:42 <vmassol> wait I tested the wrong tihng, retesting  
10:43 <vmassol> works  
10:44 <DarkKnightCZ> what is the best practice for multithreaded component? ("videolibrary", uploaded files are converted using libav (jlibav))  
10:44 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <vmassol> (msmeria)  
10:44 <vmassol> IMO you're using a wrong FAQ app version  
10:44 <vmassol> you can check that easily  
10:45 <vmassol> go to FAQCode.FAQHomeSheet  
10:45 <vmassol> verify it contains this line:  
10:45 <vmassol> ## Remove the "?" if it's the last character since the FAQ sheet adds one automatically  
10:46 <msmeria> vmassol: it doesn't  
10:46 <vmassol> so you have installed an old version  
10:46 <vmassol> :)  
10:47 <msmeria> has quit  
10:48 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <msmeria> vmassol: I was disconnected. I was saying I always install the latest version  
10:49 <vmassol> how did you do that?  
10:49 <vmassol> are you sure you enabled the snapshot repo?  
10:49 <vmassol> I'm rpetty sure you didn't  
10:50 <msmeria> I didn't  
10:50 <vmassol> :(  
10:50 <vmassol> you need to pay attention to the version you install  
10:50 <vmassol> check it  
10:51 <msmeria> I installed the latest stable version, which is 5.2.1  
10:51 <msmeria> retesting  
10:52 <evalica1> has quit  
10:52 <sburjan> has quit

10:53 <vmassol> (msmeria)  
10:54 <vmassol> make sure you check the jira fixfor next time!

11:02 <msmeria> vmassol: ok I will  
11:05 <evalica> has quit  
11:12 <msmeria> vmassol: how do I install FAQ app 5.3rc1 on XWiki 5.3rc1 ? I added the snapshot repo and searched for "org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-faq-ui" and "5.3-rc-1" without success. if I change the version to 5.3-SNAPSHOT I get a result, but I can't install it  
11:13 <msmeria> Dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity-5.3-SNAPSHOT] is not compatible with core extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity-5.3-rc-1]  
11:13 <vmassol> msmeria: 5.3RC1 is not fully released yet, why are you testing with it?  
11:14 <mflorea> has quit  
11:14 <tmortagne> msmeria: use 5.3-SNAPSHOT, not 5.3-rc-1  
11:14 <msmeria> vmassol: I got it from maven to check the Jiras fixed for it. tmortagne: thanks  
11:15 <tmortagne> rc1 is not released yet si EM won't find it  
11:15 <vmassol> msmeria: it's not because a jira says fixed for 5.3RC1 that 5.3RC1 is released  
11:15 <vmassol> I don't understand your point  
11:15 <tmortagne> s/si/so/  
11:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <msmeria> vmassol: I know that  
11:16 <msmeria> I'll test XWIKI-9755 once rc1 is fully released  
11:17 <vmassol> msmeria: you can test with 5.3-SNAPSHOT  
11:17 <vmassol> no need to wait  
11:18 <vmassol> I don't understand why you install 5.3-SNAPSHOT and want to test extension on 5.3-rc-1  
11:18 <msmeria> ok. thanks for the clarification  
11:18 <vmassol> you install 5.3-SNAPSHOT you test extensions on 5.3-SNAPSHOT  
11:18 <vmassol> you install 5.3-rc-1 you test extensions on 5.3-rc-1  
11:19 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way how to handle large file upload in xwiki (e.g. videos)?  
11:19 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: with FS attachments  
11:19 <vmassol> google it you'll find it  
11:20 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, nice :)  
11:22 <msmeria> "you install 5.3-rc-1 you test extensions on 5.3-rc-1" - that's what i wanted to do, but as you said I can't do that until rc1 is fully released. I will test it on snapshot. sorry for the mix up. I thought once rc1 is on maven it's fully functional, including the extensions. I was wrong  
11:22 <vmassol> no you're not fully wrong  
11:22 <vmassol> but there are things you don't know  
11:23 <vmassol> 1) version range check  
11:23 <vmassol> 2) e.x.o is not maven.xwiki.org  
11:23 <vmassol> and EM checks e.x.o when searching  
11:23 <vmassol> (unless you use advanced search)  
11:24 <msmeria> yes, and with advanced searching I wasn't able to install faq app 5.3rc1  
11:24 <vmassol> now  
11:24 <vmassol> because of 1)  
11:24 <vmassol> now  
11:24 <vmassol> if rc1 is really on maven  
11:24 <vmassol> I have no clue why you're testing with XWiki 5.3-SNAPSHOT instead of 5.3-rc-1  
11:24 <msmeria> I'm not  
11:24 <msmeria> you missunderstood  
11:25 <msmeria> I'm on 5.3RC1  
11:25 <vmassol> then no issue it should work fine  
11:25 <vmassol> Dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity-5.3-SNAPSHOT] is not compatible with core extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity-5.3-rc-1]  
11:25 <vmassol> suggest otherwise though  
11:26 <msmeria> that's from when I was trying to install faq app 5.3-snap on 5.3rc1  
11:26 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <vmassol> why don't you install faq app 5.3rc1!!!!  
11:26 <msmeria> you install 5.3-rc-1 you test extensions on 5.3-rc-1" - this is what i was trying to achieve  
11:27 <msmeria> how ?  
11:27 <vmassol> that's 2)  
11:27 <msmeria> then as I said before, I have to wait for the release to be over..  
11:27 <vmassol> no  
11:28 <vmassol> you said it's on maven already  
11:28 <vmassol> just use advanced search  
11:28 <vmassol> chec my 2) above  
11:28 <vmassol> \*check  
11:28 <msmeria> 5.3-rc-1 -> this is what I wrote in the version field and I didn't got any result  
11:29 <vmassol> then it's not on maven  
11:29 <vmassol> but you said it is  
11:29 <vmassol> :)  
11:29 <vmassol> what id did you use?  
11:29 <msmeria> XWiki 5.3rc1 is on maven  
11:29 <msmeria> not faq app  
11:29 <msmeria> that's what i was talking about  
11:29 <vmassol> not possible  
11:30 <vmassol> xe comes after platform in the release process  
11:30 <vmassol> you can see it's there: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-faq-ui/  
11:30 <msmeria> then, please: write here a step by step tutorial on how I can install faq app 5.3rc1 on xwiki 5.3rc1  
11:30 <vmassol> just I said 10 times already  
11:31 <vmassol> let's try once more  
11:31 <vmassol> :)  
11:31 <vmassol> in EM UI  
11:31 <vmassol> you sue advanced search  
11:31 <msmeria> humor me  
11:31 <vmassol> id: org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-faq-ui  
11:31 <vmassol> version: 5.3-rc-1  
11:31 <vmassol> that should work since the FAQ app is on maven  
11:31 <msmeria> We couldn't find any extension with id 'org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-faq-ui' and version '5.3-rc-1'. Make sure you have the right extension repositories configured.  
11:32 <vmassol> have you removed thje maven repo from your config by any chance?  
11:32 <vmassol> if you did, then you should have tol dus  
11:32 <msmeria> no. I've just added the snapshots one  
11:32 <vmassol> .....  
11:32 <vmassol> show me  
11:32 <msmeria> let me look  
11:32 <vmassol> my guess is that you removed it  
11:33 <vmassol> my guess is that you uncommented one line  
11:33 <vmassol> but not 3  
11:33 <vmassol> you override the default with only 1 repo, the snapshot repo (which you don't need btw)  
11:33 <msmeria> yeah  
11:33 <msmeria> that was it  
11:33 <vmassol> (since you're installing 5.3-rc-1 now)  
11:34 <msmeria> I've just uncommented the snapshot one  
11:34 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <msmeria> but shouldn't faq app rc1 be recommended as default on xwiki 5.3rc1 ?  
11:35 <vmassol> that's because the release i snot finished  
11:35 <msmeria> that was the original issue  
11:35 <msmeria> :)  
11:35 <vmassol> so we haven't updated exo yet  
11:35 <msmeria> ok  
11:35 <vmassol> that was my point 2)  
11:36 <msmeria> success !!  
11:36 <vmassol> msmeria: next time check this too: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan53RC1  
11:36 <vmassol> you can follow what's been done  
11:36 <vmassol> you can see this step: " [OPTIONAL] You can force update extensions on http://extensions.xwiki.org/ using the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Scheduler/"  
11:36 <vmassol> it's not done yet  
11:38 <msmeria> vmassol: thanks for the help. 9755 is fixed  
11:38 <vmassol> FYI this is a job that runs once per day so if the RM doesn't do it, it'll be sync anyway but may take a few more hours  
11:38 <vmassol> I know, I had a test for it ;) but thanks for testing  
11:43 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <vmassol> tmortagne is going to be happy :)  
11:47 <vmassol> (fyi tmortagne1 guillaume is removing the code wiki)  
11:47 <tmortagne1> cool  
11:48 <tmortagne1> has quit  
11:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> mflorea: what's up with the release?  
12:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: you pushed some commit from GD yesterday, be careful to merge it to the 5.3 rbanch  
12:03 <tmortagne> vmassol: I know but I was supposed to wait for RC1 to be released  
12:03 <vmassol> yes this is why I'm asking mflorea  
12:03 <mflorea> vmassol: the maven release is done since this morning. I'm on paper work (currently documenting my work on solr)  
12:04 <vmassol> mflorea: so we can commit again right?  
12:04 <mflorea> so you can commits on stable-5.3.x  
12:04 <vmassol> ok  
12:04 <mflorea> yep  
12:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: how do you cherry pick a merge?  
12:22 <vmassol> you use the -m option?  
12:23 <tmortagne> you can cherry pick a commit, but cherry pick a merge I don't know what it means :)  
12:23 <vmassol> error: Commit fbb5881e62fff12764c0c5c5ab6c173d7afc577b is a merge but no -m option was given.  
12:24 <tmortagne> I did a very standard cherry-pick: git cherry-pick  -x da2ad9efb53a22533de8a5044c43f47b8c41ad09  
12:24 <tmortagne> I have no idea what -m is about, never used it  
12:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's an issue you have with a cherry-pick you do or you can't pull my cherry-pick ?  
12:25 <vmassol> I think I need to find the real commit  
12:25 <vmassol> this one was my merge  
12:25 <tmortagne> yes I cherry-pick the actual commit  
12:26 <vmassol> I see:  
12:26 <vmassol> commit fbb5881e62fff12764c0c5c5ab6c173d7afc577b  
12:26 <vmassol> not sure what "Merge:" shas are  
12:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: when you validate a pull request it add two commits in the log  
12:27 <tmortagne> the real commit is the previous one  
12:27 <vmassol> nope  
12:27 <vmassol> check git log on platform  
12:27 <vmassol> it's before that  
12:27 <vmassol> I've found it anyway  
12:27 <vmassol> but it was a few commits down  
12:28 <vmassol> apparently the dates are kept strangely  
12:28 <tmortagne> does not make much sense, I always seen them near each other  
12:28 <tmortagne> if it's old yes maybe indeed it's reordered in the log  
12:29 <vmassol> so the id was the second shas in Merge: 943512d fdd9a7a  
12:29 <vmassol> ot sure what the frist one was  
12:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: you have the real commit as parent of the merge commit  
12:30 <tmortagne> the second parent in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2223a645f8c460a8f6e1a36bc5b976532d998044 for example  
12:30 <vmassol> so first is parent and second is the real commit  
12:30 <tmortagne> or https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/fdd9a7a521adff1c6258904c15d054286a5dd300 for a better example  
12:31 <tmortagne> looks like it  
12:31 <tmortagne> works for those two at least  
12:35 <vmassol> since GD is not here I hope his stuff builds fine  
12:36 <vmassol> some spam coming  
12:36 <vmassol> (I think)  
12:36 <vmassol> hmm  
12:36 <vmassol> I trigerred the repository job on exo  
12:37 <vmassol> "Batch importer scheduler"  
12:37 <vmassol> strange that nothing happens  
12:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: any idea?  
12:37 <vmassol> there was no trigger error  
12:38 <vmassol> shall I stop it and schedule it again?  
12:38 <vmassol> trying that  
12:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <vmassol> not better it seems  
12:38 <tmortagne> vmassol: no idea  
12:38 <vmassol> seems it's broken  
12:39 <vmassol> rying to execute it in a page  
12:39 <tmortagne> worked well last time and nothing changed AFAIK  
12:40 <vmassol> is it somehting that takes a long time to execute?  
12:40 <vmassol> answer: no  
12:40 <tmortagne> not for one extension  
12:40 <vmassol> doesn't work on my page  
12:40 <vmassol> either  
12:40 <vmassol> it returned  
12:41 <vmassol> the extensions are found: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/VMATest  
12:41 <vmassol> so it seems to be: services.repository.importExtension(extension[0], extension[1]) not working  
12:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: wait, what do you expect exactly ?  
12:43 <tmortagne> it's not going to import 5.3RC1 if that's what you are trying  
12:43 <tmortagne> it import stable versions  
12:43 <tmortagne> unless there is only beta versions  
12:43 <UCC> has quit  
12:43 <vmassol> 5.2.2 is stable no?  
12:43 <tmortagne> yes  
12:44 <vmassol> so it should import it  
12:44 <tmortagne> did not seen you had released 5.2.2 already  
12:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: don't forget to update version on stable-5.2.x branch  
12:49 <vmassol> indeed  
12:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: hmm it seems to be an issue with the AETHER cache  
13:00 <tmortagne> I deleted php macro metada file from aether cache and it worked  
13:00 <tmortagne> no idea why aether keep this in cache for so long  
13:00 <tmortagne> I don't remember this issue before  
13:01 <tmortagne> I deleted the whole aether cache  
13:01 <tmortagne> starting the update  
13:01 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: have you been able to test it?  
13:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: good news from Scott:  
13:25 <vmassol> "I've closed the last few bugs, and punted a few to fix in 2.8.  
13:25 <vmassol> I'll start the release process for 2.7 on Monday."  
13:25 <vmassol> I need to retest his fix for the title  
13:33 <vmassol> oh I need to send the BFD result too  
13:33 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
13:49 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <DarkKnightCZ> is there xwiki core as dependency for maven? i need to access Attachments in Component

22:05 <sajjadg> has joined #xwiki  
22:15 <sajjadg> hey guys. is it possible to start with a database and then move your data to another DB? for example let say I want to use xwiki bundle Standalone installation (that comes with jetty and hsqldb) on my laptop (offline) and then move it to my server later?  
22:16 <vmassol> sajjadg: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup You can also export to a XAR and reimport (make sure you use the latest version if you do so, like 5.3RC1)  
22:17 <sajjadg> vmassol, why an RC version?  
22:17 <vmassol> because we just coded a scalable version of our import/export  
22:18 <vmassol> so it'll work whatever size your wiki is  
22:18 <vmassol> otherwise if it's not too large the previous version will work fine  
22:22 <sajjadg> aha. very good.  
22:27 <sajjadg> q: what's the difference between Standalone installation and graphical installation jar file?  
22:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
22:27 <vmassol> none  
22:27 <sajjadg> :)  
22:28 <vmassol> one is a zip that you just unzip  
22:28 <vmassol> the other one has an installer that does the unzip for you  
22:30 <sajjadg> it there a public wiki that I can see and work with? something like a demo?
